meaning: Clearly stated or shown; leaving nothing implied
example: The teacher gave explicit instructions for the assignment.

meaning: Extremely unpleasant or offensive
example: His obnoxious behavior at the party annoyed everyone.

meaning: Shockingly bad or brutal
example: The weather was atrocious, with heavy rain and strong winds.

meaning: Fluent and persuasive in speaking or writing
example: Her eloquent speech moved the entire audience to tears.

meaning: Mysterious and difficult to understand
example: The enigmatic smile on the painting has puzzled viewers for centuries.

meaning: Able to recover quickly from difficulties
example: The resilient community rebuilt after the devastating flood.

meaning: Showing great attention to detail; very careful
example: The scientist was meticulous in recording all experimental data.

meaning: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically
example: She took a pragmatic approach to solving the budget problem.

meaning: Lasting for a very short time
example: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few weeks.

meaning: Well-meaning and kindly
example: The benevolent stranger helped the lost child find their way home.

meaning: Present, appearing, or found everywhere
example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

meaning: Open to more than one interpretation; unclear
example: His ambiguous answer left everyone confused about his position.

meaning: Persistent and determined
example: Her tenacious spirit helped her overcome numerous obstacles.

meaning: Using more words than needed; wordy
example: The verbose report could have been summarized in two pages.

meaning: Truthful and straightforward; frank
example: I appreciate your candid feedback about my performance.

meaning: Hardworking and careful in one's work
example: The diligent student reviewed her notes every evening.

meaning: The occurrence of fortunate events by chance
example: Meeting my business partner at that cafe was pure serendipity.

meaning: Having an insatiable appetite for something
example: She is a voracious reader, finishing several books each week.

meaning: Lacking interest or excitement; ordinary
example: He wanted to escape his mundane routine and travel the world.

meaning: Engaged in deep thought, often with sadness
example: She sat by the window with a pensive expression on her face.

meaning: Inspiring fear or respect through power or skill
example: The team faced a formidable opponent in the championship.

meaning: Expressed clearly; easy to understand
example: Despite his illness, his explanation was remarkably lucid.

meaning: Spreading widely throughout an area or group
example: The smell of fresh bread was pervasive throughout the bakery.

meaning: Severe in manner or appearance; strict
example: The monk lived an austere life with few possessions.

meaning: Certain to happen; unavoidable
example: Change is inevitable in any growing organization.

meaning: A subtle difference in meaning or expression
example: Understanding cultural nuances is essential for effective communication.

meaning: Having great energy or enthusiasm for a cause
example: The zealous volunteers worked tirelessly for the campaign.

meaning: Perfect; without flaws
example: Her impeccable taste in fashion made her a style icon.

meaning: Given to sudden changes of mood or behavior
example: The capricious weather made it difficult to plan outdoor events.

meaning: Very great or intense; showing deep insight
example: The book had a profound impact on my understanding of history.

meaning: Highly skilled or proficient at something
example: She is adept at solving complex mathematical problems.

meaning: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something
example: He felt ambivalent about moving to a new city for work.

meaning: Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult
example: Climbing the mountain was an arduous task.

meaning: Having or showing sharp judgment; clever
example: The astute investor predicted the market trends accurately.

meaning: Forming a united whole
example: The team was cohesive and worked well together on the project.

meaning: Easily seen or noticed; attracting attention
example: Her bright red jacket made her conspicuous in the crowd.

meaning: Feeling or expressing remorse; sorry
example: He was contrite after realizing his mistake.

meaning: Abundant in supply or quantity
example: She took copious notes during the lecture.

meaning: Hasty and not thorough
example: He gave the report a cursory glance before the meeting.

meaning: Settling an issue; having the ability to make decisions quickly
example: Her decisive leadership led the team to victory.

meaning: Skillful and quick in action
example: The chef’s deft movements impressed all the guests.

meaning: Unconventional and slightly strange
example: The artist was known for his eccentric fashion sense.

meaning: Showing the ability to understand and share feelings of others
example: She was empathetic towards the victims of the disaster.

meaning: Serving as a desirable model; outstanding
example: His exemplary conduct earned him the employee of the year award.

meaning: Very attentive to detail; meticulous
example: The fastidious editor corrected every small error in the manuscript.

meaning: Having or showing passionate intensity
example: She was a fervent supporter of animal rights.

meaning: Tending to attract attention because of exuberance or style
example: His flamboyant personality made him stand out at parties.

meaning: Economical in use or expenditure; thrifty
example: Living a frugal lifestyle helped him save money.

meaning: Fond of company; sociable
example: The gregarious host entertained everyone at the party.

meaning: Unfortunate; unlucky
example: The hapless traveler missed his flight due to traffic.

meaning: Widely recognized and well-established
example: The Eiffel Tower is an iconic symbol of Paris.

meaning: Forbidden by law, rules, or custom
example: The police cracked down on illicit activities in the city.

meaning: About to happen
example: The dark clouds suggested that a storm was imminent.

meaning: Treating all rivals or disputants equally; fair
example: The judge was impartial in making her decision.

meaning: Continuing without pause or interruption
example: The incessant noise from construction disturbed the residents.

meaning: Feeling anger at unfair treatment
example: She was indignant when accused of cheating.

meaning: Impossible to subdue or defeat
example: His indomitable spirit inspired everyone around him.

meaning: Easily angered
example: The irascible coach shouted at players for minor mistakes.

meaning: Having, showing, or done with good judgment
example: She made a judicious decision after reviewing all the facts.

meaning: To express sorrow, regret, or unhappiness
example: He lamented the loss of his childhood home.

meaning: Very generous or forgiving
example: The magnanimous king forgave his enemies.

meaning: Having or showing a wish to do evil to others
example: The villain had a malevolent look in his eyes.

meaning: Easily influenced or shaped
example: Children’s minds are malleable at a young age.

meaning: Of only average quality; not very good
example: The meal was mediocre and not worth the price.

meaning: A complete change of form or nature
example: The caterpillar underwent metamorphosis into a butterfly.

meaning: Feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed
example: He gave a nonchalant shrug when asked about the issue.

meaning: No longer produced or used; out of date
example: Typewriters are now considered obsolete technology.

meaning: Having unlimited power; able to do anything
example: The king was considered omnipotent in his kingdom.

meaning: Designed to impress or attract notice
example: Her ostentatious jewelry caught everyone’s eye.

meaning: Seemingly absurd or self-contradictory
example: It was paradoxical that the richest man was the unhappiest.

meaning: Carried out with minimum effort or reflection
example: He gave a perfunctory nod without listening carefully.

meaning: Relevant or applicable to a particular matter
example: She asked questions that were pertinent to the discussion.

meaning: Seeming reasonable or probable
example: His explanation for the mistake was plausible.

meaning: Evoking a keen sense of sadness or regret
example: The movie’s ending was deeply poignant.

meaning: A difficult, unpleasant, or embarrassing situation
example: She found herself in a predicament when her car broke down.

meaning: Producing much fruit or work; highly productive
example: The prolific author published five novels in a year.

meaning: Acting with or showing care and thought for the future
example: It is prudent to save money for emergencies.

meaning: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned
example: They stayed in a quaint cottage in the countryside.

meaning: Representing the most perfect or typical example
example: She was the quintessential student, always diligent and kind.

meaning: Avoiding the company of others; solitary
example: The reclusive writer rarely gave interviews.

meaning: Elegant and cultured in appearance or behavior
example: He had a refined taste in art and music.

meaning: Unwilling and hesitant
example: She was reluctant to speak in front of the class.

meaning: Filled with regret or guilt
example: He was remorseful after breaking his friend’s phone.

meaning: Able to recover quickly from difficulties
example: The resilient athlete returned to competition after injury.

meaning: Having or showing keen mental discernment; wise
example: The sagacious leader guided the country through difficult times.

meaning: Diligent, thorough, and extremely attentive to details
example: The scrupulous accountant checked every transaction carefully.

meaning: Performed or occurring as a result of a sudden impulse
example: Their spontaneous trip to the mountains was exciting.

meaning: Loyal, reliable, and hardworking
example: He was a stalwart supporter of the charity organization.

meaning: Delicate and precise; not obvious
example: The artist used subtle shades to create depth in the painting.

meaning: Unnecessary, especially through being more than enough
example: The essay had superfluous details that distracted from the main point.

meaning: Reserved or uncommunicative in speech
example: The taciturn student rarely participated in class discussions.

meaning: Able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection
example: The lawyer presented a tenable argument in court.

meaning: Very weak or slight; insubstantial
example: His connection to the company was tenuous at best.

meaning: Free from disturbance; calm
example: The tranquil lake reflected the mountains perfectly.

meaning: Lasting only for a short time; temporary
example: The transient beauty of sunset amazed everyone.

meaning: Dangerous or deceptive
example: The icy roads were treacherous for drivers.

meaning: Idealistic; aiming for a perfect society
example: He had a utopian vision of a world without poverty.

meaning: Accorded a great deal of respect, especially because of age or wisdom
example: The venerable professor was admired by all his students.

meaning: Clear someone of blame or suspicion
example: The evidence served to vindicate the accused man.

meaning: Attractive, lively, and animated
example: Her vivacious personality lit up the room.
